alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 3:00AM MST until December 29 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and patchy blowing snow. Snow showers increasing through day today and continuing into the overnight. Total snow accumulations generally ranging from 2 to 5 inches, with locally higher amounts above 7000 feet. Southwest winds gusting 35 at times, leading to areas of patchy blowing snow. * WHERE...Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau. Including Buffalo Pass, Ganado and Window Rock. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Slippery and snow covered roads could led to very difficult travel. Areas of patchy blowing snow could reduce visibility at times. Hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Snow forecast from 11 AM this morning to 5 AM Wednesday: Buffalo Pass 4 to 8 inches Ganado 2 to 4 inches Window Rock 2 to 4 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
